title: Anyone know of a similar font?
content:
Hi There

I’m doing some artwork in the theme of a 1950’s movie poster and I’m trying my darnedest to find a font similar to the one seen here. Any ideas?

Thanking you in advance for your time.

[http://origin.myfonts.com/s/aw/720x360/44/0/22851.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20090910200538/http:/origin.myfonts.com/s/aw/720x360/44/0/22851.png "http://origin.myfonts.com/s/aw/720x360/44/0/22851.png")

author: BrazenRaisin

comments.content:
Hi Brazen,

the font in question is [Blanchard](http://web.archive.org/web/20090910200538/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/blanchard/).  
In case you’re looking for alternatives, here are a few options:

[Filmotype Zanzibar](http://web.archive.org/web/20090910200538/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?key=FILM-ZANZ&preadd=action)  
 [Adana](http://web.archive.org/web/20090910200538/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/astype/adana/)  
 [Bernhard Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20090910200538/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/bernhard-script/)  
 [Coronet](http://web.archive.org/web/20090910200538/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype_library/coronet_std_ot_virtual/?&sample_text=The%20Swinging%20Letters)  
 [Diskus](http://web.archive.org/web/20090910200538/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/diskus/)  
 [Minuet](http://web.archive.org/web/20090910200538/http:/www.canadatype.com/showfont.php?id=120)  
F

Hi Florian

Thank you so much for your reply. You’re suggestions were great, but they’re missing one thing in particular that I’m looking for. I’m ideally looking for something with the elaborate tails. And the capitals (like the “S”) in particular, the way the top part crosses over the rest of the letters... any ideas? I appreciate any suggestions!
Then please tell us, why don’t you go with Blanchard? What’s wrong with it?
I have a fussy client - it’s nice “but not quite right”, and “the letters are too narrow”.
Ok, not to worry. Many thanks for your time.
